author: James Joyce
text: Come round on Friday. Got leave to go in garden today. Send you two limericks written in dark Thereâ€™s a donor of lavish largesse Who once bought a play in MS He found out what it all meant By the final instalment But poor Scriptor was left in a mess. There is a clean climber called Sykes Who goes scrambling through ditches and dykes To skate on his scalp Down the side of an alp Is the kind of diversion he likes J.J.
